column4: JPMorgan's Bear wins end to billionaire Wang's lawsuit
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. federal judge on Friday dismissed a lawsuit in which the wife of California billionaire Roger Wang accused Bear Stearns Cos of duping her and her husband into buying the investment bank's stock just before it nearly collapsed in 2008.

column4: Former JP Morgan executive to lead UBS sub-Saharan Africa unit
column5: CAPE TOWN Switzerland's banking group UBS said on Friday a former co-head for JP Morgan Chase's African arm would take over the helm of its Africa unit from September.

column4: LG Display shares hit lowest in almost a year after fall in panel prices
column5: SEOUL Shares of LG Display Co Ltd fell sharply in early trade on Friday  hitting their lowest point in almost a year  after data from researcher DisplaySearch showed industry-wide display panel prices were broadly lower.

column4: UK weighs September RBS sale to avoid Lloyds clash: sources

column5: WASHINGTON  June 5 The U.S. Air Force on Friday said last year's catastrophic F-35 engine failure  which grounded the entire fleet of jets built by Lockheed Martin Corp  for a month  cost over $50 million.

column4: UPDATE 1-Russia's VTB says reaches preliminary deal with indebted miner Mechel
column5: ST PETERSBURG  Russia  June 5 Russian lender VTB  has reached a preliminary agreement with mining company Mechel on restructuring its debt and is ready to postpone some of the company's debt repayments until 2018-2019  Chief Executive Andrey Kostin said on Friday.

column4: Russia's VTB reaches preliminary deal with Mechel - Kostin
column5: ST PETERSBURG  Russia  June 5 Russian lender VTB has reached a preliminary agreement with mining company Mechel on its debt restructuring and is ready to postpone Mechel's debt until 2018-2019 with some conditions attached  Chief Executive Andrey Kostin said on Friday.

column4: Monsanto plots pricey Syngenta comeback amid growing scepticism
column5: LONDON/FRANKFURT U.S. agrochemicals firm Monsanto Co and its advisers are working flat out to accommodate Syngenta's qualms about regulatory hurdles to a deal whose perils may well outweigh the rewards.

column4: Detroit homeowners try to revive Morgan Stanley class action
column5: Banks will be unaccountable for some of the worst abuses of the subprime mortgage era unless a decision denying class status for a lawsuit against Morgan Stanley is overturned  lawyers suing the investment bank told a federal court.

column4: For risk-wary gold miners  small is beautiful
column5: TORONTO Bigger isn't better for the world's gold miners  who are increasingly making "bite-sized" developments that carry less risk of budget disasters and fewer of the political and environmental disputes that have derailed mega-mines in recent years.

column4: RPT-Brazil soccer probe to put harsh glare on Nike  other sponsors
column5: SAO PAULO/BRASILIA  June 5 Nike Inc and some other big international companies face a grilling over their powerful role in Brazilian soccer as a former star player turned senator vows to expose what he describes as suspect marketing contracts and their links to corrupt payments.

column5: LONDON  June 4 (IFR) - Standard Bank's former head of emerging markets research ex-Africa Timothy Ash is to join Japanese rival Nomura in a senior research position  according to two sources with knowledge of the information.

column4: UPDATE 3-France "opposed" to Israel boycott amid Orange row
column5: PARIS  June 5 France's foreign minister sought to calm a row with Israel on Friday  saying Paris opposed any boycott of the Jewish state  but stressed telecom firm Orange  which plans to end its licence deal there  was free to define its own policy.

column4: Coal giant Peabody faces federal scrutiny over clean-up insurance
column5: WASHINGTON Coal giant Peabody Energy has been among the harshest critics of federal energy policies  joining a court challenge to the Obama administration's new clean air regulations and denouncing its promotion of renewable fuels.

column4: Petrobras goes all out for a Century
column5: NEW YORK  June 5 (IFR) - Brazil's Petrobras bet big and won this week after printing a US$2.5bn Century bond - the largest-ever trade with this tenor and the oil company's first bond sale since a corruption scandal locked it out of the capital markets last year.

column4: MOVES-Infrastructure investor body appoints Prudential's Farnum-Schneider as chairman
column5: LONDON  June 5 The newly-formed Global Infrastructure Investor Association (GIIA) said on Friday it had appointed Matthew Farnum-Schneider  a managing director at insurer Prudential  as its first chairman.

column5: The backers of payment processing company Worldpay are set to hire six banks to lead the company's London stock market listing  valued at around 6 billion pounds ($9.22 billion)  a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: RPT-Deal between T-Mobile and Dish could spell trouble for Sprint
column5: NEW YORK  June 4 A merger of T-Mobile US Inc  and satellite TV company Dish Network Corp  could force Sprint Corp to pursue a deal or partnership itself.

column4: Synergy's plans to fight Steris prompted FTC merger challenge
column5: A new court filing on Monday shed more light on why the Federal Trade Commission decided to challenge Steris Corp's $1.9 billion bid for the UK's Synergy Health PLC.

column4: Italtel eyes sale to private equity investor this summer - CEO
column5: MILAN Italian telecoms equipment and software supplier Italtel has hired investment bank JP Morgan  to seek buyers  in particular among private equity funds  and expects to reach a deal this summer  its chief executive told Reuters on Friday.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: June 5 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Friday:

column4: Teva raises its stake in acquisition target Mylan
column5: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd  has increased its stake in Mylan NV  to nearly 2.2 percent as it presses on with an unsolicited bid for its generic drug-making rival  a regulatory filing showed on Friday.

column4: Whistleblower case over chemo drug can go ahead - judge
column5: A judge in Philadelphia has refused to dismiss a whistleblower lawsuit accusing a Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Inc unit of paying kickbacks to doctors to promote off-label use of its chemotherapy drug Treanda.
